name: isfinite

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)), wcel(com, universe))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
-| wcel(com, universe)
-| wi(wcel(com, universe), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Fin ↔ c0[≺]_om)
⊣ _om ∈ 𝕌
⊣ (_om ∈ 𝕌 →(c0 ∈ Fin ↔ c0[≺]_om))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
-| wcel(com, universe)
-| wi(wcel(com, universe), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Fin ↔ c0[≺]_om)
⊣ _om ∈ 𝕌
⊣ (_om ∈ 𝕌 →(c0 ∈ Fin ↔ c0[≺]_om))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
-| wi(wcel(com, universe), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(com, universe), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)))

comment: A set is finite iff it is strictly dominated by the class of natural number. Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. The Axiom of Infinity is used for the forward implication. (Contributed by FL, 16-Apr-2011.)
